message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM 

The paper proposes a method for object segmentation tracking in videos using optical flow and image boundaries. This task falls under computer vision, specifically in the subfield of video analysis and segmentation. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of motion cues for robot navigation, which suggests a potential application in robotics (cs.RO - Robotics). The paper also discusses the use of variational models, which is a common technique in machine learning (cs.LG - Machine Learning). The paper also mentions the use of state-of-the-art CNN-based segmentations, which is a common technique in artificial intelligence (cs.AI - Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper evaluates its method on video datasets, which suggests a potential application in multimedia (cs.MM - Multimedia).
